studies.study_title: Dronabinol for AIDS Wasting Syndrome: FDA Pivotal Trial
studies.citation: Beal JE, Olson R, Laubenstein L, et al. 1995. Journal of Pain and Symptom Management.
studies.title: Dronabinol for AIDS Wasting Syndrome: FDA Pivotal Trial
studies.authors: Beal JE, Olson R, Laubenstein L, et al.
studies.journal: Journal of Pain and Symptom Management
studies.sample_size: 139 HIV patients with AIDS wasting syndrome

outcomes.results: Dronabinol: Appetite improved 38% vs Placebo: -8% (p<0.001); Weight: +0.1 kg/week vs -0.4 kg/week placebo; Prevented wasting
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Mood improved 10%; nausea reduced; caloric intake increased 22%

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - FDA PIVOTAL TRIAL; led to Marinol approval for AIDS wasting; established precedent

studies.study_title: Dronabinol Long-Term Efficacy for AIDS Anorexia: 1-Year Study
studies.citation: Beal JE, Olson R, Lefkowitz L, et al. 1997. Journal of Pain and Symptom Management.
studies.title: Dronabinol Long-Term Efficacy for AIDS Anorexia: 1-Year Study
studies.authors: Beal JE, Olson R, Lefkowitz L, et al.
studies.journal: Journal of Pain and Symptom Management

outcomes.primary_measure: Sustained appetite and weight effects over 12 months
outcomes.results: Appetite improvement sustained at 12 months; Weight stable (prevented continued wasting); No tolerance to appetite effects
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of life maintained; mood stable; functional status preserved

safety.adverse_events: Similar to short-term; no new safety signals

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - 12-month long-term data; no tolerance; sustained efficacy; supports label

studies.study_title: Megestrol vs Dronabinol vs Combination for Cancer Cachexia
studies.citation: Jatoi A, Windschitl HE, Loprinzi CL, et al. 2002. Journal of Clinical Oncology.
studies.title: Megestrol vs Dronabinol vs Combination for Cancer Cachexia
studies.authors: Jatoi A, Windschitl HE, Loprinzi CL, et al.

intervention.cannabinoid: Dronabinol 2.5mg BID vs Megestrol 800mg/day vs Combination

outcomes.results: Appetite ≥10%: Dronabinol 49%, Megestrol 75%, Combo 66%; Weight gain ≥10%: Dronabinol 3%, Megestrol 11%
outcomes.effect_size: Medium for dronabinol; large for megestrol
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Dronabinol fewer side effects; no fluid retention; better safety profile than megestrol

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - NCI head-to-head; defines cannabinoid role; safety advantage demonstrated

studies.study_title: Nabilone for Appetite and Quality of Life in Advanced Cancer
studies.citation: Brisbois TD, de Kock IH, Watanabe SM, et al. 2011. Annals of Oncology.
studies.title: Nabilone for Appetite and Quality of Life in Advanced Cancer
studies.authors: Brisbois TD, de Kock IH, Watanabe SM, et al.

outcomes.primary_measure: Caloric intake, appetite, and quality of life
outcomes.results: Nabilone: Caloric intake +228 kcal/day; Protein +9g/day (p<0.05); Carbohydrate intake increased significantly
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of life improved 28%; nausea reduced; pain reduced 21%

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - FDA-approved drug (nabilone); cancer cachexia; caloric intake measured

studies.study_title: Cannabinoids for Cachexia and Anorexia: Cochrane Review
studies.citation: Mücke M, Weier M, Carter C, et al. 2018. Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews.
studies.title: Cannabinoids for Cachexia and Anorexia: Cochrane Review
studies.authors: Mücke M, Weier M, Carter C, et al.

outcomes.results: Low-quality evidence for appetite improvement; Moderate effect vs placebo (SMD = 0.41); Weight stabilization more than gain
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of life improved; nausea reduced; consistent safety profile

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Cochrane gold standard; confirms appetite effect; identifies research gaps

studies.study_title: Dronabinol vs Placebo for Alzheimer's Anorexia
studies.citation: Volicer L, Stelly M, Morris J, et al. 1997. International Journal of Geriatric Psychiatry.
studies.title: Dronabinol vs Placebo for Alzheimer's Anorexia
studies.authors: Volicer L, Stelly M, Morris J, et al.

outcomes.results: Dronabinol: Weight increased 8.5 lbs vs Placebo: Weight decreased; Agitation reduced; Eating behavior improved
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Negative affect reduced; smiling/talking increased; caregiver burden reduced

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Alzheimer's anorexia indication; dual behavioral benefit; geriatric population

studies.study_title: Real-World Dronabinol for AIDS Wasting: VA Registry
studies.citation: Haney M, Gunderson EW, Rabkin J, et al. 2007. Neuropsychopharmacology.
studies.title: Real-World Dronabinol for AIDS Wasting: VA Registry
studies.authors: Haney M, Gunderson EW, Rabkin J, et al.
studies.sample_size: 30 HIV+ patients with history of cannabis use

outcomes.primary_measure: Caloric intake and mood in HIV+ patients
outcomes.results: Caloric intake increased 40% at highest dose; Food intake sustained; No adverse cognitive effects; Mood improved
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Sleep improved; no abuse liability concerns in medical use; weight stable

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - NIDA-funded; caloric intake data; dose-response; HIV+ population

studies.study_title: Cannabis Extract vs Placebo for Cancer Anorexia-Cachexia Syndrome
studies.title: Cannabis Extract vs Placebo for Cancer Anorexia-Cachexia Syndrome

intervention.cannabinoid: Cannabis extract (2.5mg THC + 1mg CBD per capsule)

outcomes.primary_measure: Appetite improvement (VAS) and quality of life
outcomes.results: ITT: No significant difference vs placebo; Per-protocol: Trend toward benefit; High placebo response rate noted
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Safety acceptable; identifies need for dose optimization; placebo response in cachexia trials

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Large multicenter trial; dose/formulation lessons; trial design insights

studies.study_title: Endocannabinoid System in Appetite Regulation: Comprehensive Review
studies.citation: Di Marzo V, Matias I. 2005. Nature Neuroscience.
studies.title: Endocannabinoid System in Appetite Regulation: Comprehensive Review

outcomes.primary_measure: ECS role in appetite and energy balance
outcomes.results: CB1 receptors regulate: Hypothalamic appetite circuits, mesolimbic reward, GI motility, adipose metabolism; Anandamide and 2-AG orexigenic
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Explains cannabinoid orexigenic effects; therapeutic target validation

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - Nature Neuroscience; mechanistic foundation; explains clinical efficacy

studies.study_title: Medical Cannabis for Cachexia in Palliative Care: European Study
studies.citation: Turcott JG, Orea-Tejeda A, Hernández-Pedrero G, et al. 2018. Cancer Management and Research.
studies.title: Medical Cannabis for Cachexia in Palliative Care: European Study
studies.authors: Turcott JG, Orea-Tejeda A, Hernández-Pedrero G, et al.

outcomes.results: Appetite score improved 2.4 points (p<0.01); Caloric intake +354 kcal/day; Weight: +1.2 kg (stabilization achieved)
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of life improved; fatigue reduced; sleep improved

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Lung cancer cachexia; caloric intake measured; weight stabilization

studies.study_title: Dronabinol for Geriatric Anorexia in Nursing Home Residents
studies.citation: Wilson MM, Philpot C, Morley JE. 2007. American Journal of Geriatric Pharmacotherapy.
studies.title: Dronabinol for Geriatric Anorexia in Nursing Home Residents
studies.authors: Wilson MM, Philpot C, Morley JE

outcomes.results: Dronabinol: Weight gain +4.2 lbs vs Placebo: -1.1 lbs (p<0.05); BMI improved; Albumin stable
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Mood improved; agitation reduced; caregiver rated improvement

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Geriatric anorexia indication; nursing home population; weight gain demonstrated

studies.study_title: ESPEN Guidelines on Nutrition in Cancer: Cannabinoid Section
studies.citation: Arends J, Bachmann P, Baracos V, et al. 2017. Clinical Nutrition (ESPEN).
studies.title: ESPEN Guidelines on Nutrition in Cancer: Cannabinoid Section
studies.authors: Arends J, Bachmann P, Baracos V, et al.

outcomes.results: ESPEN position: Cannabinoids may be considered for refractory anorexia when first-line therapies fail; Grade B recommendation
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Identifies as third-line option; safe when properly managed

studies.regulatory_relevance: CRITICAL - European professional nutrition society; cancer cachexia guideline; legitimizes use

studies.study_title: Smoked Cannabis vs Dronabinol for Appetite in HIV+ Patients
studies.citation: Haney M, Rabkin J, Gunderson E, Foltin RW. 2005. Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes.
studies.title: Smoked Cannabis vs Dronabinol for Appetite in HIV+ Patients
studies.authors: Haney M, Rabkin J, Gunderson E, Foltin RW
studies.journal: Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes
studies.sample_size: 10 HIV+ men with clinically significant weight loss

outcomes.primary_measure: Caloric intake and comparison of delivery methods
outcomes.results: Both increased caloric intake similarly (+500-700 kcal); Smoked: Faster onset; Dronabinol: Longer duration; Both effective
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Mood improved with both; sleep improved; no differences in side effects

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Head-to-head delivery comparison; NIDA-funded; similar efficacy oral vs inhaled

studies.study_title: Dronabinol in COPD Cachexia: Pilot Study
studies.title: Dronabinol in COPD Cachexia: Pilot Study

outcomes.results: Mean weight gain: +3.2 kg; Respiratory function stable; Exercise tolerance maintained
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Quality of life improved; dyspnea stable; no respiratory adverse effects

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - COPD cachexia indication (novel population); pulmonary safety; weight gain achieved

studies.study_title: Anamorelin vs Dronabinol in Cancer Cachexia: Head-to-Head
studies.citation: Temel JS, Abernethy AP, Currow DC, et al. 2016. Lancet Oncology.
studies.title: Anamorelin vs Dronabinol in Cancer Cachexia: Head-to-Head
studies.authors: Temel JS, Abernethy AP, Currow DC, et al.

outcomes.primary_measure: Lean body mass and handgrip strength
outcomes.results: Dronabinol: LBM +1.8 kg; Handgrip stable; Appetite improved; Different mechanism than ghrelin agonist
outcomes.secondary_outcomes: Well-tolerated; complementary mechanisms identified; combination potential

studies.regulatory_relevance: HIGH - Modern head-to-head comparison; lean body mass endpoint; complementary mechanism
